channel.title: Dead Boy Found Buried in Playground Sand
channel.description:
ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. - (May 16) - Forensic experts searched a public park late into the night for evidence of who buried the body of a little boy in the playground's sand. The investigation began Friday afternoon when a woman who took her children to the city park in Albuquerque spotted part of child's shoe sticking out of the sand. She called police. Investigators later found the body of a boy they believe is between the ages of 3 and 5. Forensic experts with the state's Office of the Medical Investigator told police the boy could not have been dead longer than 48 hours, police spokesman John Walsh said. Police had received no reports of missing children in the day before the discovery, Albuquerque Police Chief Ray Schultz told a news conference. Schultz said the boy may be from the neighborhood surrounding Alvarado Park but wouldn't elaborate. "This is one of those cases where I think every minute counts," Schultz said, appealing to the public for help. Schultz would not say whether there were any wounds on the body. The boy was wearing a red shirt with the image of a four-wheel drive truck on the front, black nylon pants with red stripes and black shoes.
[url=http://news.aol.com/article/dead-boy-playground-sand/486154]http://news.aol.com/article/dead-boy-playground-sand/486154[/url] That would be very creepy to notice.

item.title: Dead Boy Found Buried in Playground Sand
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:9, topic:278872”][quote author=cooper link=topic=368105.msg2790119#msg2790119 date=1242691590]

I doubt they died… people don’t die in spongebob.

iirc, it was in the episode “Bubble Buddies” - Spongebob buried him up to his neck, and told his friend, Bubble Buddy (who was actually a bubble shaped like a human) to unbury him. You see him frown and say “Dude?” at Bubble Buddy before the scene changes. Later, he appears as a ghost and says “They made me experience high tide!” or something similar and begins laughing as he floats off to “Heaven” with a halo and an angelic chorus.
[/quote]

Gotta love how there can be beaches underwater. :P[/quote]

It could happen. You just gotta believe.

Read full topic
item.source: Dead Boy Found Buried in Playground Sand

item.title: Dead Boy Found Buried in Playground Sand
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“PeterMan, post:7, topic:278872”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=368105.msg2788201#msg2788201 date=1242593167]

I doubt they died… people don’t die in spongebob.

I think he is referring to the child who buried himself in the sand to find the fictional character ‘spongebob’; a tide came in - he drowned.
[/quote]
Seriously?

Got a link or something, can’t seem to find it on google.

Found this though: http://www.mangatutorials.com/bb/viewtopic.php?t=11271&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=0&sid=2b6735291383c1fb931b524e295860e8[/quote]I hope this isn’t another Gaara impersonation =/

EDIT:

Found that on the site, I think it fits this. Seriously, how fucking stupid can you get?

Read full topic
